title: Smash Burgers
tagline: Crispy lacy edges, diner-style perfection. Fast and simple.
description: Crispy-edged, diner-style smash burgers. 2-oz patties, scorching hot pan. Serves 4.
ingredients: Suggested Toppings: Pickle slices, thinly sliced onion, ketchup, mustard, mayo, shredded lettuce
steps: Divide beef into 8 equal balls (2 oz each). Don't pack them tight—keep them loose.
Heat cast iron skillet or griddle over HIGH heat until smoking hot. This is crucial.
Place 2-4 balls on the hot surface (don't crowd). Immediately smash flat with a sturdy spatula. Press HARD for 10 seconds. Should be very thin.
Season the top with salt and pepper AFTER smashing (not before).
Cook 2 minutes until edges are brown and crispy. Flip.
Immediately add cheese slice. Cook 1 more minute.
Toast buns in the beef fat on the same pan. Assemble and serve immediately.
notes: Why season AFTER smashing: Salt draws moisture from raw meat. Salting after = better crust.
American cheese: Melts better than anything else. This is not the time for fancy cheese.
The smash: Press as thin as possible. The goal is maximum surface contact = maximum crust.
Why 2 thin patties: More crust per burger. That crust is the whole point.
Ventilation: This creates smoke. Open windows or turn on the fan.
source: Adapted from Serious Eats / Kenji López-Alt
